user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_ctz_index:
```c
static int lfs_ctz_index(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_off_t *off) {
    lfs_off_t size = *off;
    lfs_off_t b = lfs->cfg->block_size - 2*4;
    lfs_off_t i = size / b;
    if (i == 0) {
        return 0;
    }

    i = (size - 4*(lfs_popc(i-1)+2)) / b;
    *off = size - b*i - 4*lfs_popc(i);
    return i;
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
lfs_off_t b = lfs->cfg->block_size - 2*4;
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation: the assignment lfs_off_t b = lfs->cfg->block_size - 2*4; is an ordinary computation and does not create code that can never be executed. It does not make any following statements unreachable, so MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is not violated by this fragment. (Note: this line can still lead to runtime/UB issues—e.g. b == 0 causing a division by zero later or signed/unsigned underflow depending on types—but those are not instances of unreachable code.)
